Blackfang's optics widened as Devilcat ordered that all the intruders
were to be taken down. That was not an ally the Maximals should have.

Blackfang: HEY! What the heck is he doing?!?! Rodimus, who do we shoot on?

His fingers were tense over the trigger of his shotgun and he kept
track of Devilcat's head.

Tyrael was up in the air and the few shots that came at him missed widely.

Tyrael: Oh? Wasn't the area secure enough? Bloodthirsty stupid
Rogues... Hitting Kaiser in one of his duel is not something you
should do. Too bad you have to learn it the hard way.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Devilcat/Rogues::
> 
> Devilcat's form shimmers into being nearby.  "Greetings, friends.  I 
> thought I'd tag along, seeing as a number of my people are down 
> there."  He recloaks and makes his way down below to meet up with his 
> fellow Rogues.
> 
> Decloaking again, he looks at Riekan.  "Well, what's the situation?"
> 
> "This fellow says he'll join whatever faction proves to be the 
> strongest," the taller bot answers.  "They want to see us fight."
> 
> "Then we'll fight," says Devilcat.  Turning, he indicates Tyreal, 
> Kaiser, and Starstorm - the three visible enemies.  "Forget the 
> normal routine.  Take them all down."
> 
> All five bots open up with their respective weapons, blazing away 
> indiscriminately at anything that's Tripredacus or Predacon.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000 <airly2002@h...>"
